alert.note: Alert for Albany (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 07 at 6:50PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EDT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central New York, including the following county, Albany. * WHEN...Until midnight EDT tonight. * IMPACTS...Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 650 PM EDT, local law enforcement reported heavy rain in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 3 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Westerlo, Berne, Preston Hollow, Preston-Potter Hollow, Knox, Rensselaerville, Shoefelt Corners, South Berne, Snyders Corners, Bensons Corners, Helderberg, Zucks Corners, East Berne, Smith Corner, Bramans Corners, West Berne, Medusa, Lambs Corner, Thompsons Lake and Thatcher State Park. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
